questions.question: What is the chemical formula of the cage used as a precursor in the synthesis of PTC-236?
questions.answer: Ti4L6

questions.question: What method was employed to achieve the optical resolution of the Ti4L6 cages?
questions.answer: Using enantiopure left-handed and right-handed cations.

questions.question: How were the homochiral ΔΔΔΔ- and ΛΛΛΛ-[Ti4L6] cages obtained?
questions.answer: Through the complete resolution using enantiopure cations.

questions.question: What is the role of bimb in the structure of PTC-236?
questions.answer: Bimb ligands connect the Zn1 atoms in an infinite helical chain along the c-axis.

questions.question: What property of PTC-236 allows it to undergo single-crystal-to-single-crystal transformation for guest structure analyses?
questions.answer: Its high framework stability and rich recognition sites provided by the Ti4L6 moieties.

questions.question: What was the unique feature of the post-assembly modification strategy used in this study?
questions.answer: It involved the expansion and fixation of the MOC into a porous framework to improve its stability in the crystal state.

questions.question: What was the main challenge in studying host–guest complexes at the molecular level, and how was it addressed in this study?
questions.answer: The main challenge was the requirement of high-quality single crystals of host MOC for guest exchange and structure analysis, which was addressed by using a post-assembly modification strategy to improve crystal state stability.

questions.question: Why were homochiral ΔΔΔΔ- and ΛΛΛΛ-[Ti4L6] cages specifically targeted for synthesis?
questions.answer: Because their homochirality and optical resolution could provide a basis for constructing homochiral cage-based microporous frameworks for molecular isomer recognition and separation.

questions.question: How does the presence of chiral pore channels in PTC-236 contribute to its application in host–guest chemistry?
questions.answer: The chiral pore channels, along with the rich recognition sites, facilitate the study of host–guest interactions and enable selective recognition and separation of isomeric molecules.

questions.question: What was the significance of achieving a single-crystal-to-single-crystal transformation in the study of PTC-236?
questions.answer: It allowed for the direct observation and analysis of host–guest interactions between the titanium cage and captured guests using X-ray diffraction, providing clear insights into the molecular behavior.

questions.question: How did the researchers ensure the homochirality of the synthesized PTC-236 frameworks?
questions.answer: By employing a chiral Ti4L6 cage as a precursor and using enantiopure cations for the complete resolution of ΔΔΔΔ- and ΛΛΛΛ-[Ti4L6] cages.

questions.question: What role does the solvothermal reaction play in the synthesis of PTC-236?
questions.answer: The solvothermal reaction of the ΔΔΔΔ-[Ti4L6] and ΛΛΛΛ-[Ti4L6] cages with bimb and Zn(CH3COO)2·2H2O at 80 °C for 6 h produced the PTC-236 frameworks.

questions.question: Is the PTC-236 framework stable in water and common solvents?
questions.answer: True

questions.question: Can PTC-236 undergo single-crystal-to-single-crystal transformation without maintaining its crystal structure?
questions.answer: False

questions.question: Is PTC-236 only applicable for the recognition and separation of aromatic molecules?
questions.answer: False

questions.question: Does the post-assembly modification strategy limit the size of the PTC-236 crystals that can be synthesized?
questions.answer: False

questions.question: Are the homochiral ΔΔΔΔ- and ΛΛΛΛ-[Ti4L6] cages obtained without using enantiopure cations?
questions.answer: False

questions.question: Is the PTC-236 framework unstable in air over long periods?
questions.answer: False

questions.question: Can PTC-236 selectively separate trans-CIN from an isomeric mixture?
questions.answer: True

questions.question: Is the post-assembly modification strategy used in this study a common approach for all metal-organic frameworks?
questions.answer: False
